comments:
Open a java editor and close it ... leads to a Widget is disposed error.  I'm
investigating it to see if it's related to the patch for bug 96129

This error is in the N20050813-0010, so it's not related to bug 96129.

PW

Silenio,

Do you have time to have a quick look at these dispose errors?

This problem showed up in N20050813-0100, but they weren't there in I20050811-0010.

Closing editors (I've tried with Java and text) generates a "Widget is disposed"
error after trying to get rid of the Caret. 

Thanx,
PW

I will take a look. This is probably caused by the changes for bug#45708 and 
bug#4862. We have re-written the way the SWT.Dispose callback is sent.

I was not able to reproduce the problem with I20050816-1235. Is there any other
steps to reproduce this?

(In reply to comment #4)
> I was not able to reproduce the problem with I20050816-1235. Is there any other
> steps to reproduce this?

I just installed I20050816-1235, created a new workspace, grabbed the latest
platform-ui projects.

Open 3 java files, close 3 java files, and I have 3 widget disposed errors.

Maybe it's a Linux-GTK only problem?

PW

Kim said she tried it on her Mac and didn't get the dispose errors, but for me
it's easy to reproduce.

My linux system is:
Red Hat Enterprise Linux WS release 4 (Nahant Update 1)
Linux wspwebster 2.6.9-11.EL #1 Fri May 20 18:17:57 EDT 2005 i686 i686 i386
GNU/Linux
gtk2-2.4.13-14

PW

I've verified that SWT from HEAD fixes my problem.  Thanx.

PW
I'll be releasing this for I20050818-0800
